meanings.definition: To discharge or excrete waste material from the body.
meanings.sent1: The bird egested food remains after digesting.
meanings.sent2: The cat egested hairballs on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The dog egested a surprise on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The volcano egested molten lava into the air.
meanings.sent5: The garbage truck egested a foul odor as it passed by.

meanings.definition: To expel or eject something from within.
meanings.sent1: The machine egested coins when the button was pressed.
meanings.sent2: The magician egested a rabbit from his hat.
meanings.sent3: The clown egested confetti during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The printer egested paper smoothly without any jams.
meanings.sent5: The factory egested smoke from its chimneys all day long.
